full_summary:
### Rental of Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV), Ultra Short Base-Line (USBL) and Sonar Systems (plus Operator and Training)

**Notice Solicitation Number:** 30004374
**Reference Number:** cb-7082-12544383
**Publication Date:** July 10, 2023
**Closing Date:** July 24, 2023 (13:00:00)

**Description:**
The Bedford Institute of Oceanography (BIO), on behalf of Fisheries and Oceans Canada, Environment and Climate Change Canada, Department of National Defense, National Resources Canada and the Canadian Coast Guard, requires the rental of a fully operational Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV) system consisting of an OceanusPro ROV (or equivalent) and ancillary equipment (tethers, umbilical, tag lines, etc.) with an experienced operator and training sessions for a period of up to 18 days.

**Additional Deliverables:**

* A spare ROV system (fully operational) is required, due to the remote location and limited timeframe for mission completion.
* Ultra-Short Baseline (USBL) acoustic positioning system
* Sonar system
* Specialized storage is not available, and equipment must maintain full serviceability for at least 2 weeks.

**Mission Schedule:**
* The equipment is required in Resolute Bay by August 10, 2023.
* The mission is expected to take place between August 15 and September 2, 2023.
* Training sessions will be held between July 10 and August 14, 2023.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The selection criteria for this procurement is based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Contracting Entity Information:**
* Contracting Entity Name: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* Contact Information:
	+ Name: Marie-Carmen Sedji
	+ Email: DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
	+ Phone: (506) 473-7358

**Attachments:**
Please see the attached files for the Request for Proposal (RFP) and Addendum 1, available on the [Canada Buys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/7082/30004374---rfp-eng_0.pdf).

Note: The rewritten entry has retained the essential information while rephrasing and condensing the original text to meet the 400-word
